Header: 51st commemoration of senior politician D. A. Rajapaksa marked
Content: The 51st commemoration of senior politician D. A. Rajapaksa was held at Tangalle under the patronage of Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapakse. Mr. D.A. Rajapaksa, a former speaker and a Deputy Minister of Agriculture and Lands, was a former MP from Hambantota and Beliatta. Mr. D. A. Rajapaksa, who played a vital role in founding and strengthening the Sri Lanka Freedom Party, has also done a yeoman service to the Hambantota District. The 51st commemoration ceremony commenced paying a floral tribute to his statue at Tangalle. The Prime Minister, members of the Rajapaksa family, public representatives and schoolchildren participated in the event. Following the floral tribulation, Ven. MirisseDhammawanshaThero conducted a special Anusasana. Sisura scholarships were presented to school children in the memory of Mr. D.A.Rajapaksa at the Tangalle Town Hall.
